title: His Dark Materials’ intense trailer warns of terror ahead for Lyra as hidden enemies come after her
text:
Lyra has no idea of the dangers waiting for her in His Dark Materials (Picture: BBC)

His Dark Materials latest trailer teases just how perilous a quest our heroine Lyra (Dafne Keen) is about to go on as dark forces begin to follow her.

Ahead of the show’s release on 3 November, Lyra is seen trying to recruit helpers as she’s chased by the mysterious Miss Coulter (Ruth Wilson).

‘The child is destined to be important,’ Coulter is heard saying in soft but menacing tones. ‘She matters more than she can ever know.

‘The fate of more than this world depends on her,’ she continues. ‘Tell me where she is, or I will destroy all of this.’

It seems that Coulter isn’t the only person to be aware of Lyra’s destiny, as the teenage girl takes on a journey that could change numerous realms.

The all-star cast including Lin-Manuel Miranda, James McAvoy and James Cosmo are seen as the battle commences for the mysterious unknown, as the epic music playing alerts viewers to just how big this series is going to be.

"She matters more than she can ever know." This autumn, one child will change worlds. #HisDarkMaterials starts 3rd November on @BBCOne & @BBCiPlayer. pic.twitter.com/ezEdr49aPg — BBC One (@BBCOne) October 21, 2019

And if that doesn’t convince you, there’s a massive armoured polar bear in chains and ready for war to prove it further.

Viewers have less than two weeks before the first episode is unleashed to the public and our Sunday nights will never be the same again once it does.

The big budget production comes connected to HBO, who are clearly making this the epic to replace Game Of Thrones we’ve all been waiting for.

Investing £40million into the production, and the second season already being filmed, we promise you, it’s worth it.

Trying to find something to watch while you wait for it? Don’t worry, we’ve got you covered for that too.

His Dark Materials starts Sunday 3 November on BBC One.
